projects.content:
After realising that the "tet" in tetris comes from the greek "τετρα" meaning 4,  I wondered
if I could create a general n-tris based on the [Polyomino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polyomino#Enumeration_of_polyominoes).
projects.title: N-Tris

projects.content:
Inspired by my use of excel, I decied to create my own web version of excel that can
run in the browser. 

# Spreadsheet
This is a spreadsheet I am making for fun in Imba (https://imba.io/)

# Goals of Development
- [x] infinite scrolling
- [x] store spreadsheet in localstorage
- [x] formulas
- [x] keyboard shortcuts
- [x] dragging cells
projects.title: SpreadSheet
projects.description: A simple spreadsheet I wrote in the browser

projects.content:
Have you ever wanted to walk on the surface of a complex mapping?
I have designed a game where a player can gain a real intuisionistic grasp for how
complex analysis works using this fun simulation.
projects.title: Complex Projection Game
projects.description: A game that simulates what it would be like to walk on the surface of a complex mapping

projects.content:
I was inspired by the mathematical [24 game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24_(puzzle))
where players try to use mathematical operations to form a nuumber (in this case 24)
I decided to extend this game to all known mathematical operations by creating
this game that any math enthuiast will love
projects.title: Make the Number
projects.description: Use the given numbers to create a target number

projects.content:
I created this game for the [Paly Python Climate Change Hackathon](https://palypython.com/climate-change-hackathon). Unfortunately, it did not win, but it was still a lot of fun
to make this game. I learned how to use godot, and I became proficient in using godot.
projects.title: Environmentalism Game

projects.content:
# About
I am writing up all proofs given in the textbook
"proofs from THE BOOK" by Aigner and Ziegler in the
proof assistant Lean to check if the proofs are logically correct. If you want to see my current progress, go to
[chapter 1](https://github.com/eulerthedestroyer/proofs-from-the-book/blob/master/chapters/chapter_1.lean)

# Proofs From the Book

The mathematician Paul Erdős said "The Book" is where God keeps the most elegant proof of each mathematical theorem.

# Lean
Lean is a formal theorem prover that checks that all proofs are logically consistent
projects.title: Proofs From the Book
projects.description: Formally Verifying the most elegant proofs

projects.content:
When I found myself having to paste the same code over again, I thought to create a repository
to store these most common scripts.
projects.title: Common scripts
projects.description: The most common scripts are 1 click away

projects.content:
sprouts is a game invented by the mathematician John Conway. In the game, there are seeds,
and lines connected between them. I decided to program this game.
projects.title: Sprouts

projects.content: Inspired by nitro type, I made a typing simulator and trainer to help improve my own typing speed. I managed to increase it by 10 WPM using this tool
projects.title: Typing Simulator

projects.content:
I wanted to create a game to teach young children how to add numbers.
I learned a lot from this project about how to consider my audience.
I think I could have made this project even better if I had kept in
mind that my target audience was children.
projects.title: Number Trainer

projects.content:
Traditionally, code golf is a coding sport where participants try to solve a coding challenge in as few keystrokes as possible. In my speedrunning game, called speedcoding,
participants compete to code as quickly as possible. This game is great for anyone who lives for speed.
projects.title: Speed Coding

projects.content:
Inspired by all the cool sorting alogoethms I was learning about, I decided
to create a game where I would race against each sorting algorithm to learn about them
projects.title: Can You Beat the Sorter?
projects.description: A game to explore sorting algorithms

projects.content:
I wanted to create my own game in html, so I made this. I was inspired by flappy
bird and other related games. It has many levels and an uprgade shop.
projects.title: Dodging Game
projects.description: A simple game I made in HTML

projects.content:
I used to play this fun game in school with my friends, so I was
inspired to program it in HTML. This was the first game that I ever programmed,
and I'm still proud of it.
projects.title: Ultimate Tic Tac Toe
